sentences.sentence: Let's start by looking at our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Russia plans joint military exercises in Belarus in a move that will increase tensions with the West over Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's former president, Petro Poroshenko, returns to Kiev, vowing to help protect the ex-Soviet country from a possible Russian invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And a new book reveals who it claims is most likely to have betrayed Jewish teenage diarist Anne Frank and her family. Russia has begun moving troops to Ukraine's northern neighbor Belarus for joint military

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: exercises, a move that further strains relations with the West.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The EU High Representative for Foreign Affairs Josep Borrell warned on Monday that Russia is seeking the de facto integration of eastern Ukraine into its territory through its massive military build-up from Crimea to Donbass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Visiting Ukraine, Germany's foreign minister said they're ready for serious dialogue with Russia but will not compromise on basic principles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: She is due to meet with her Russian counterpart on Tuesday.

sentences.sentence: We will do everything to guarantee Ukraine's security and we will do everything to guarantee Europe's security." Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov has rejected US allegations that Moscow is preparing a pretext to invade Ukraine, dismissing the claim as total disinformation.

sentences.sentence: No doubt that Ukraine today is under the external control of the United States.

sentences.sentence: A delegation of U.S. senators is visiting Ukraine to emphasize Washington's support for the country and has threatened to impose crippling economic sanctions if Russia invades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: economic sanctions if Russia invades. Ukraine's former president Petro Poroshenko has returned to Kiev from Warsaw to fight

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: charges of high treason.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Prosecutors have set bail at 30 million euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Poroshenko addressed supporters who are outside the court.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: He told them he had returned to help protect his country from a possible Russian invasion, despite the risk of arrest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The charges come amid heightened tensions with Russia over its troop buildup along Ukraine's eastern border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Peter Dickinson is the Ukraine editor of the international affairs think tank the Atlantic Council. He says that the prosecution could have major political ramifications.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The charges are potentially explosive for Ukraine's democracy. I think it's crucial to underline here that Petro Poroshenko is not only Ukraine's former president, he's also the chief rival to the current president, Volodymyr Zelensky. So the prosecution is seen by many as an attempt by Zelensky to discredit his main rival, to undermine him, and in particular to tar him with the brush of treason, you know, obviously the most explosive charge that could be levelled against any head of state, really. And Poroshenko's great strength is seen as he is seen as a patriotic leader who led Ukraine through the very difficult first years of the conflict with Russia from 2014.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: So the idea of now labeling him as a traitor essentially is potentially very damaging for him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But also the political nature of the charges and of the case in general casts quite a shadow over Ukraine's credentials.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We're talking about a split between the two leading figures in Ukrainian politics, potentially very polarizing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: If the prosecution proceeds, and if, for example, Poroshenko is convicted, or even if he's held in detention, it will create enormous tension at a time when Ukraine's national unity is crucial.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We have approximately 100 to maybe more Russian troops on the border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

sentences.sentence: At this stage, Ukraine's security situation is on a knife edge and arguably the last thing the country needs is to have a major political crisis. So a lot of people in Kiev are questioning exactly why President Zelensky feels that now is a good time to take on this issue. New record high COVID-19 infections in Russia are raising fears of a storm of cases in coming

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It is an open question as to whether or not Omicron is going to be the live virus vaccination that everyone is hoping for because you have such a great deal of variability with new variants emerging.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Novak Djokovic received a warm welcome when he returned to Serbia after Australia deported the world men's tennis number one. Djokovic, who is unvaccinated, left after his visa was cancelled on public interest grounds. Only fully vaccinated non-Australian travellers are allowed to enter the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The 34-year-old had won nine previous Australian Opens and many Serbians were outraged by the Australian government's decision. I'm so sorry about Nole and I hope so that he played tennis on other tourney or on Grand Slams like Roland Garros and we send him all our love and positive energy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I don't know his next steps. I hope that he will find a way to play at the other tournaments while having his freedom of choice to take the vaccine or not now the question that's hanging over djokovic is whether he will be allowed into future tournaments with this whole ordeal slowly coming to an end the serbian public is most interested in two things one is novak's next steps is he going to stay in serbia and train or go to spain and second what happens in the next tournaments? We already heard the news that Roland Garros organizers are considering excluding unvaccinated players, so everybody is eager to hear whether the problems for Nowak are going to continue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: From Belgrade, for Euronews, Bojan Brkic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In another twist in the story of Anne Frank, the hiding place of the young Jewish writer

sentences.sentence: who lived in a secret annex for two years during World War II was leaked to the Nazis by a Jewish notary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: That's according to an investigative team who say a letter from Otto Frank, Anne's father, suggests Arno van der Berg exposed the family to guarantee his safety and his daughter's.
